metadata.source: GP Bio.md, research/people/, vc-research-summary.md, LinkedIn profiles

general_partners.name: Dillon Dunteman

education.extracurricular: Varsity lightweight crew (walked on as novice)

professional_experience.description: Growth equity investments in enterprise SaaS
claimed_activities: Deployed $1.0+ billion across 15+ deals (primarily Series C+ growth)
Deployed ~$320M across 3 cybersecurity companies (KnowBe4, Acronis, Deepwatch)
Spearheaded AI research and strategy for team (2023-2025)
professional_experience.verification_notes: Vista employment verified (LinkedIn). Individual attribution for $1B+ deployment unclear without role specifics. Vista is $100B+ AUM firm with teams.

professional_experience.description: Enterprise SaaS buyouts and venture arm buildout
claimed_activities: Built out venture arm from scratch
Scaled businesses via organic growth and M&A

claimed_exits.timing_issue: Exit occurred 16 months AFTER Dillon left Firmament (joined Vista Sept 2021)
Exit occurred 6 months AFTER Dillon left Firmament

professional_experience.verification_notes: Firmament employment verified. Both exits occurred AFTER departure. Attribution unclear: work during employment vs retroactive credit?

claimed_performance.notes: Net of fees and expenses. Based on latest-round markups, not realized exits.

top_holdings.note: Attribution ambiguous: Firmament institutional vs personal

details: 3 of next 4 investments in 2020-2021 were underperformers
1 company fire-sold for pennies on the dollar ~1 year after investment
2 of 16 companies (15+ month holding) shut down

personal_venture_portfolio.verification_notes: Performance based on unrealized markups. Only 6 of 24 companies documented. Small sample size with extreme concentration (Figure >50% of value).

thought_leadership.timing_concern: Substack launched AFTER first investment (Quantinuum March 2020), suggesting retroactive narrative construction rather than prospective thesis development

activities: Fundraising assistance (Normal Series A, Dirac seed strategy)
strategic_support.verification: unverified - all claims from dataroom, no independent founder testimonials

relationship_quality: 'Better technical understanding than major VCs' (Quantinuum founder testimonial, dataroom)
'First call when raising' (Normal CEO testimonial, dataroom)
claimed_value_add.verification_status: ALL UNVERIFIED - 100% of evidence from dataroom only, zero public validation

key_deal_sources: Founders Fund (Dirac co-lead via claimed intro)
Also Capital / Mike Annunziata (mentor, Mesh Optical)

network.network_assessment: Quality over quantity - strategic relationships with key firms, but modest connection counts

strengths: Genuine technical background (Harvard ME, quantum/robotics coursework)
Two exceptional portfolio winners (Figure 94x, Quantinuum 6.7x verified)
Tier-1 co-investor validation (Founders Fund, Coatue, Microsoft, NVIDIA, Bezos)
Thought leadership demonstrates sustained intellectual engagement
concerns: CRITICAL: All value-add claims unverified (100% from dataroom)
CRITICAL: Multiple funding discrepancies (Dirac, Normal) undermine credibility
CRITICAL: Customer claims contradicted (Dirac: Anduril, Stellantis, Lockheed)
HIGH: Performance based on unrealized markups, not exits
HIGH: Portfolio extremely concentrated (Figure >50% of value)
HIGH: Attribution ambiguity (individual vs Firmament/Vista institutional credit)
HIGH: Thought leadership appears retroactive (launched AFTER first investment)
MEDIUM: Failed investments not disclosed (names, dates, lessons)
MEDIUM: Only 6 of 24 portfolio companies documented
verification_priorities: CRITICAL: Verify Dirac-Founders Fund introduction (key GP value-add claim)
CRITICAL: Verify Tamarack Global relationship depth
CRITICAL: Resolve funding discrepancies (Dirac $6M vs $10.7M, Normal $17M vs $35M)
HIGH: Verify Normal advisory role and equity award
HIGH: Conduct independent founder reference calls
HIGH: Request full 24-company portfolio list with dates, amounts, valuations
MEDIUM: Verify Vista role and deployment attribution
MEDIUM: Verify Quantinuum attribution (Firmament team vs individual)

overall_assessment.summary: Dillon demonstrates strong technical background, access to quality deals, and opportunistic timing. Two exceptional winners validate investment judgment. However, extreme concentration risk (Figure >50%), unverified value-add claims, funding discrepancies, and retroactive narrative concerns require extensive due diligence.

general_partners.name: Henry Bellew

portfolio_involvement.mentions: ZERO across entire portfolio (dataroom or external)

network.note: Henry's LinkedIn connections not analyzed. No network data available.

concerns: CRITICAL: Zero portfolio involvement across 14 companies
CRITICAL: Zero mentions in dataroom or external research
CRITICAL: No documented contribution to fund operations
HIGH: For GP to show zero involvement in companies with 94x-6.7x MOICs is highly unusual
HIGH: Raises questions about division of labor, value justification, team utilization
MEDIUM: Only 2 years post-graduation experience
MEDIUM: Network analysis not available
verification_priorities: URGENT: Clarify Henry's actual role and contribution to fund
URGENT: Interview Dillon and Henry about division of labor
HIGH: Assess Henry's non-portfolio contributions (operations, LP relations, fundraising)
HIGH: Determine if zero portfolio involvement is intentional or efficiency concern

overall_assessment.summary: Henry Bellew's complete absence from portfolio company involvement is a major red flag. For a GP to show zero documentation across 14 companies (including 5 with exceptional MOICs) is highly unusual. Urgent clarification needed on actual role, contribution, and value justification for GP economics.
overall_assessment.critical_concern: Significant value concentration risk if only Dillon actively engaged with portfolio. Henry absence reduces team redundancy and coverage.

team_dynamics.team_coverage: POOR - Single GP carrying all portfolio work
team_dynamics.redundancy: NONE - No backup if Dillon unavailable

concerns: Division of labor unclear
Henry's contribution unknown
Single point of failure (Dillon only)
division_of_labor.recommended_clarification: Interview both GPs to understand roles, responsibilities, and value distribution

value_concentration.risk_level: EXTREME - Double concentration (single company + single GP)

concerns: Henry's zero involvement is major red flag
Team lacks redundancy and coverage
Value concentration risk (single GP, single company)
GP economics may not be justified by contribution distribution
recommendations: URGENT: Clarify Henry's role and contribution
HIGH: Assess team dynamics and communication
HIGH: Evaluate GP economics relative to contribution
MEDIUM: Establish expectations for GP involvement going forward

notes: Data based on 14 researched companies out of 24 total portfolio companies
All GP value-add claims from dataroom only - no independent verification
Henry Bellew's complete absence is highly unusual and requires urgent clarification
Dillon's portfolio involvement concentrated in Tier 1 companies (100% coverage)
Network data available only for Dillon, not Henry
